patterns: I need counseling

Who are the school counselors?
Can I remain anonymous during sessions?
Do I need to book an appointment?
Is there online counseling?
responses: You can book a session with OSA counselors through the portal or visit their office.
Mental health support is always available at OSA. Visit our counseling unit anytime.
Feel free to drop by the counseling office or contact them online for help.

patterns: How to join a student organization?

Who approves new student orgs?
Where can I join the debate club?
Can I join more than one organization?
Are there interest-based organizations?
responses: Visit the OSA website or bulletin board for a list of recognized student organizations.
Yes, freshmen and all students are welcome to join organizations!
New org registration and membership forms are handled by OSA’s student engagement team.

responses: Please proceed to the OSA Help Desk for ID concerns.
You may apply for a replacement ID online or through the OSA service window.
Lost ID reports must be filed before requesting a new one at OSA.

patterns: What happens if I cheat in exams?

responses: Disciplinary cases are handled by OSA’s Student Discipline division.
You can file complaints or grievances directly at the OSA office.
OSA ensures all cases are reviewed fairly under the school conduct code.

responses: Visit the OSA Scholarships and Grants Office or check our website for ongoing programs.
Scholarship applications can be submitted via the student portal or OSA counter.
Eligibility and application steps are listed in our scholarship announcements.

responses: Check the OSA Events Board or our Facebook page for upcoming activities.
All student-led events must be coordinated with OSA for approval and logistics.
You can register for leadership trainings and events online or in-person.

responses: Please visit the OSA Lost and Found section at the main lobby.
Submit a lost/found report through our online form or help desk.
OSA keeps unclaimed items for 30 days before disposal or donation.

responses: Visit the OSA Volunteer Services page or office to register for programs.
Volunteers receive certificates and hours counted toward civic engagement.
Most outreach activities are announced online and on OSA’s bulletin.

patterns: How to get student clearance?

responses: OSA signs clearance for org dues, discipline, and ID concerns.
Submit your clearance at the OSA counter or via your department first.
Make sure to settle any pending OSA requirements before requesting clearance.
